CatDescriptText: Mrs. Charlene Wright, housewife, 2441 Bedford Ave., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. A1, with question: "Do you believe in divorce even though most religious groups frown upon it, and some actually ban it except under very extenuating circumstances?" answer reads: "I'm a Catholic and I don't believe in divorce. That's what's wrong with the world today, and the reason for so many broken homes.  Divorces are so easy to get.  My father and mother have been married for 58 years."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Charlene Wright wearing double breasted trench coat, standing outside of Jenkins Arcade, Thrift Drugs store in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
